meanings.definition: To fail to hit or reach a target.
meanings.sent1: The archer misset the bullseye by a wide margin.
meanings.sent2: I hope I don't misset the opportunity to score a goal in the game.
meanings.sent3: During the competition, he misset the target and hit the tree instead!
meanings.sent4: Her aim was true, but the strong wind caused her arrow to misset the mark.
meanings.sent5: The basketball player practiced hard to ensure he wouldn't misset any shots during the game.

meanings.definition: To make a mistake or error.
meanings.sent1: She misset the recipe by adding too much salt to the dish.
meanings.sent2: If you misset the directions, the result may not turn out as expected.
meanings.sent3: He misset the answer on purpose to see if his teacher was paying attention.
meanings.sent4: Trying to fix the clock, he accidentally misset the time even further.
meanings.sent5: It's easy to misset a step when you're learning something new.

meanings.definition: A mistake or error in judgment or action.
meanings.sent1: Making a misset in the calculation led to the wrong answer.
meanings.sent2: The coach pointed out the team's misset in the game strategy.
meanings.sent3: Her fashion misset of wearing socks with sandals made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The decision to trust him turned out to be a costly misset.
meanings.sent5: The misset in the contract caused confusion and delays in the project.
